required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Genetics of Disorders of Sex Development and Hypospadias
clinical_study.official_title: Utilizing Whole Exome Sequencing and Genomics to Improve Our Understanding of Disorders of Sex Development (DSD) and Hypospadias

brief_summary.textblock: This study seeks to identify genetic causes of conditions that affect the gonads and genitals, and to study the impact on families of receiving genetic results.

detailed_description.textblock: This study seeks to understand the genetic causes of conditions that affect the development of the genitals, such as disorders of sex development (DSD) and hypospadias, and the impact on families of receiving genetic results. The investigators are recruiting individuals with DSD and/or hypospadias without a clear genetic cause along with their family members for our research study. The investigators will collect samples for genetic studies. The investigators will review the clinical record for history, labs and physical exam information. The investigators will also build a tissue bank of blood, urine, and discarded tissues from surgeries. The investigators will return results of genetic testing to parents/guardians of children with DSD/hypospadias and have them complete questionnaires to assess the impact of receiving these results.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months after return of genetic results

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months after return of genetic results compared to baseline
3 months after return of genetic results compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Score on Child Health Worry Scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months after return of genetic results compared to baseline
3 months after return of genetic results compared to baseline
3 months after return of genetic results compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Score on Kansas Marital Satisfaction Scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months after return of genetic results compared to baseline
baseline, 3 months after return of genetic results
secondary_outcome.description: Score on Questionnaire, "Stigma Related to Having a Child with a Urogenital Condition"

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 3 months after return of genetic results
secondary_outcome.description: Score on Questionnaire, "Quality of Life Related to Having a Child with a Urogenital Condition"

arm_group.description: Subjects will provide a DNA sample, which will be screened for variants in genes related to DSD/hypospadias. Probands/parents who wish to receive results of genetic testing related to DSD/hypospadias will receive these results directly from the research study. Parents who receive results of genetic testing for probands under 12 years of age will complete questionnaires at the time of enrollment, right after receiving genetic results, and 3 months after receiving genetic results.

intervention.description: The results of testing for genetic causes of DSD/hypospadias will be returned to parents of subjects who elect to receive these results.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Genital or gonadal abnormalities as evidenced by physical examination or imaging (including but not limited to hypospadias, microphallus, clitoromegaly, ambiguous genitalia), with no cause identified by standard clinical evaluation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to provide informed consent
